news.title: Mnangagwa, Tagwirei In Joint Mazowe “Rally”
news.content:
By A Correspondent A promotional flier for President Emmerson Mnangagwas title deeds distribution programme in Mashonaland Central has ignited a storm inside Zanu PF, after businessman Kudakwashe Tagwireis image overshadowed the Presidents  fuelling speculation that the event is doubling as a joint political rally showcasing Mnangagwas preferred ally over Vice President Constantino Chiwenga.

The poster, which circulated widely ahead of todays Mazowe West event, announced that Mnangagwa would preside over the issuance of 1,000 title deeds and the launch of smallholder irrigation kits. But what dominated attention was not the policy programme  it was the branding: Tagwireis portrait appeared larger, placed in a commanding position, and accompanied by a bold pledge that he would give out two Ford Ranger trucks.

For many within Zanu PF, this was no accidental publicity slip. Instead, it was read as a symbolic gesture that Tagwireis political stock is rising, with Mnangagwa seemingly positioning him as a central player in the partys future while sidelining Chiwenga.

The ruling partys Zanu PF Patriots account condemned the flier as highly inappropriate and misleading.

This is a Presidential event, and it is unacceptable to place Cde Tagwireis image on the flier  worse still, positioning it above and larger than the Presidents. Such misrepresentation undermines the dignity of the occasion. We are confident that Cde Tagwirei does not endorse this distortion, the account posted on X.

The uproar comes against the backdrop of escalating succession battles. Chiwenga, the general who masterminded the 2017 coup that ushered Mnangagwa into power, has long been considered the natural successor. But Mnangagwa has steadily worked to curtail his deputys influence, instead elevating businessmen, technocrats, and family allies.

Tagwirei  a billionaire fuel tycoon and key financier of Zanu PF  has increasingly blurred the lines between business and politics. His visible role in state programmes and his rising public profile have unsettled Chiwengas military-aligned faction, which sees him as a growing threat to their political leverage.

In Zanu PF politics, symbolism is never neutral, one political analyst remarked. Allowing a businessman to dominate the Presidents poster sends a clear message  it hints at grooming Tagwirei as a trusted ally and sidelines Chiwengas camp.

Yet beyond the intrigue, todays event remains historic. Mnangagwa is set to hand over 1,000 title deeds  the largest batch since the programmes launch in December 2024  and roll out smallholder irrigation kits to boost food security and climate resilience. Crucially, 70 percent of the beneficiaries are war veterans, a constituency central to Zanu PFs internal power struggles.

But instead of cementing Mnangagwas empowerment credentials, the Mazowe programme has been overshadowed by succession politics. With Tagwireis face looming larger than both the Presidents and the absent Vice Presidents, the event has come to be seen less as a government programme  and more as a joint MnangagwaTagwirei rally, signalling where real influence in the ruling party may be shifting.

news.title: Skies Freezes As Tendai Ndoro’s Hearse Arrives
news.content:
BREAKING NEWS: Fans Mourn as Tendai Fire Ndoros Body Arrives in Bulawayo Amid Heartfelt Tributes and Public Shock

By A Correspondent | The body of former Warriors and Orlando Pirates striker Tendai Fire Ndoro arrived in Bulawayo from South Africa yesterday aboard an Airlink flight, sparking a wave of grief, disbelief, and raw emotion across Zimbabwe and the diaspora.

A visibly shaken airport crew received the casket in sombre silence, while social media erupted as fans shared their pain, memories, and disturbing questions about the footballers sudden death.

 I cant believe its Ndoro coming out of this flight. God, wrote Lerato Sabangu, a comment that captured the collective shock.

Public Shock & Unanswered Questions

The tragedy has deeply disturbed many, not only due to Ndoros celebrity status but also the haunting manner of his death  found lifeless in his South African apartment after three days, only discovered when his phone went off and neighbours raised alarm.

 Chipo Mafukidze, a Facebook user, sparked widespread reflection with her chilling comment:

Nhai imi, ndinakatanga kuziva kuti afa. Imagine after 3 days what happened kuti vanhu vazoziva. I smell yebody or Srs zviri kundinetsa. I also stay alone and his death yakandityisa.

Her sentiments triggered dozens of responses:Patrick Kamuzhanje replied: Zvikaoma hanzvadzi. Its good to have someone close. Zvimwe akanwa doro kwakononewa kubika munhu anogona kufa nekuda kwenzara chaiyo.Shamisoo Matangira Jona added: Ndipo pazviere. Ini handina chandinoziva. Akafa nei? Airwara here? Akawanikwa akafa mumba make.

There was growing concern around Ndoros health  with some commenters revealing he may have battled diabetes.

 DG Masiziva warned:

Ndakanzwa kuti this guy was diabetic. My advice: anyone diabetic, dont live alone. Sugar ikadonha, thats the end.

Others lamented the dangers of solitary living:Kupu Lacy Adam: Kugara wega akusibhoo guys. Iva nemunhu anokuona daily.Shumirai Munguri: Ndine hama yakadonha some years ago ndakavhunduka ndakanzwa ndokuyedza kupinda mumba. Haa munhu anyarara

 A Heros Goodbye at West Park Cemetery

Back in Bulawayo, Ndoros body was received by fans, churchmates, family, and legends of the game who came to give their final respects. His funeral procession made its way through familiar streets before settling at West Park Cemetery, where tears flowed freely.

At his Bulawayo Amphitheatre memorial, Ndoros brother-in-law Chrispen Ncube broke down as he recounted finding his body.

I called him malume When I found him dead, I was disturbed and shocked Im grateful I managed to bring his body back to his parents.

His sister Lorraine added tearfully: Im in pain. I have no words.

From government to club officials, heartfelt tributes poured in:We have lost a beacon, said Isaiah Mpofu, speaking for the Ministry of Sport.He was our first import and export, recalled Tavengwa Hara of Chicken Inn.Youngsters should take football seriously, said Madinda Ndlovu, representing the Ndlovu family.

But the most stinging words came from former Warriors manager Wellington Mpandare:

Zimbabweans, why are you so evil? Someone cheated Tendai out of his investments He did not waste money. May God bless that person, he declared, drawing applause.

 A Life Remembered, A Legacy Honoured

Ndoros twin brother Takudzwa, inconsolable at the gravesite, led mourners in a song they used to sing together: Ndimi makawuraya (You are the ones who killed), echoing both grief and a veiled cry for justice.

Ndoros passing at 36 leaves behind three children  Laizah (12), Christiano (7), and Mukundi (3)  and a country searching for answers.

From the dusty pitches of Nketa to the grand stadiums of South Africa, Fire lived, loved, and inspired.

 Rest in Power, Tendai Ndoro  Our Fire Never Dies.

 Key Public Reactions:

 Kugara wega kwakaoma  Living alone is dangerous Diabetes inonzi silent killer  Fans urged others with chronic illnesses to never stay alone Phone yadzima, ndipo zvikanzi ngaatariswe  His silence led to his discovery He was robbed, not reckless  Claims of fraud against him Ndimi makawuraya  Crowd song blaming society

 Call to Action:Zimbabwes health and sports institutions are being urged to:Provide wellness checks for retired athletesOffer mental health and chronic illness supportInvestigate cases of property theft and exploitation of vulnerable public figures

news.title: CRIME CAUGHT ON CCTV: Foreign Criminal Caught After High-Profile Car-Theft Spree in Harare
news.content:
By Dorrothy Moyo |  HARARE  A daring foreign criminal who had been operating across Zimbabwes capital, targeting foreign nationals in broad daylight thefts, has finally been brought to justicethanks in part to CCTV footage like the one captured at Village Walk Shopping Centre in Borrowdale.

In the footage, a white Toyota Fortuner can be seen parked suspiciously close to a small silver hatchback. Its left passenger door is wide open, moments before a man is seen entering or exitingbelieved to be Cassian Pascal Mangombe, a 45-year-old undocumented foreign national. Mangombe was orchestrating a string of thefts from parked vehicles across high-end shopping centres in Harare.

 CAUGHT IN THE ACT:

The video shows Mangombe at the scene of the crime where he allegedly stole:

The victim was Sharif Ahmad Elamine, 26, another foreign national who had parked at Village Walk Shopping Centre. It was later revealed that the same Toyota Fortuner was used in another theft that same day at Greenfields Shopping Centre, Samora Machel Avenue, where Shaqyong Chen, 50, lost:

The total stolen in just these two attacks amounted to over US$25,000 and multiple critical identity documents.

Police spokesperson Commissioner Paul Nyathi confirmed that these incidents were part of a spree occurring between Monday and Thursday last week at:

Mangombe was tracked down by detectives from the CID Theft from Car Unit, who arrested him in Msasa, Harare, on August 22, 2025. Investigators say that by the time of arrest, he had already shipped some of the stolen laptops out of the country by busa detail that revealed his cross-border syndicate links.

Authorities suspect he may be from one of Zimbabwes neighboring countriesor even as far as Tanzaniathough his exact nationality remains unclear.

 STOLEN GOODS UPDATE:

 ZRP CALLS FOR PUBLIC VIGILANCE

Commissioner Nyathi warned the public:

We urge motorists to avoid leaving valuables in parked vehicles. Criminals are targeting public shopping centres with high foot traffic.

The Zimbabwe Republic Police has appealed for more information from members of the public and is urging anyone who may have seen Mangombe or the Toyota Fortuner during the week of the crimes to come forward.

 CCTV & CROSS-BORDER CRIME

The case highlights the critical role of CCTV surveillance in deterring and resolving urban crime. Authorities also said the investigation will look into whether Mangombe was working alone or is part of a larger regional criminal syndicate involved in trafficking stolen electronics.

As the net closes in, law enforcement is working with regional partners to stop similar crimes before they spread.

 [Scene Description from CCTV Still]

The attached image shows the moment the Toyota Fortuner (white SUV) involved in the crime was captured on surveillance. Its rear door is visibly open, aligning with the moment of the alleged theft. The setting is the open-air car park of Village Walk in Borrowdale. Multiple other vehicles can be seen parked nearbyhighlighting how the theft occurred in plain sight, in a busy urban setting.

His central role in state programmes and his growing public profile have alarmed Chiwengas military-aligned faction, which sees him as encroaching on political territory.

news.title: Eight Arrested in Beitbridge Armed Robbery Crackdown
news.content:
By A Correspondent The Zimbabwe Republic Police (ZRP) has apprehended eight men suspected of orchestrating a series of violent robberies in Beitbridge between June 19 and August 20, 2025.

The arrested suspects include Tinashe Nkomo (39), also known as Sadamu or Jeck, Future Moyo (35), Decent Moyo (35), Obey Chiware (38), Wiseman Muleya (30), Tendai Mapira (45), Khumbulani Mabhena (42), and Admire Charumbira (36). Authorities allege the gang targeted homes and businesses, stealing large sums of cash, mobile phones, and airtime vouchers.

According to police spokesperson Commissioner Paul Nyathi, the breakthrough came after detectives from CID Beitbridge traced Future Moyo, who was implicated in a robbery on July 27, 2025. In that incident, an airtime vendor in Garikai was robbed of ZAR 15,000 and two cellphones.

Moyo was arrested while offloading airtime vouchers at cut-price rates, which raised suspicion, said Nyathi. His confession led investigators to the rest of the syndicate.

During the operation, police recovered a Girsan pistol with 36 rounds, two vehicles used as getaway carsa Honda Fit (AEO 9989) and a Toyota Probox (AGT 7877)along with airtime vouchers worth US$310.

The suspects have been linked to at least nine armed robberies, including:

July 1, 2025: A house in SDP New Stands was raided, with ZAR 4,000, US$3,000, and two phones stolen.

July 16, 2025: A shop at SDP New Stands was robbed of ZAR 27,100, US$130, two phones, and shoes.

August 13, 2025: An airtime vendor in Dulibadzimu lost US$1,200, ZAR 2,000, and airtime worth US$2,500.

Another major hit involved ZAR 99,400 and US$1,550 taken from a house in New Stands.

Commissioner Nyathi praised members of the public for their cooperation:Their tip-offs were critical in dismantling this gang. We urge citizens to remain vigilant and report any suspicious activities via the National Complaints number (0242) 703631, WhatsApp on 0712 800197, or at the nearest police station.

news.title: Sad : Two People Die In Honda Fit Crash
news.content:
By A Correspondent

Two people lost their lives while ten others were injured in a road accident involving an overloaded Honda Fit on Thursday evening along the NyangaRwenya Road.

The crash occurred around 5 PM at the 48-kilometre peg, when the small vehicle, carrying far more passengers than its capacity, veered off the road and overturned, landing on its roof.

According to the Zimbabwe Republic Police (ZRP), the Honda Fit had 12 occupants including the driver at the time of the incident.

In a statement, police said:Two fatalities have been confirmed, and ten people sustained injuries after the vehicle lost control and overturned. The deceased have been taken to Nyanga District Hospital for post-mortem, while the injured are receiving treatment at Regina Coeli Mission Hospital.

Authorities have urged motorists to avoid overloading vehicles and exercise caution when travelling on rural roads.

news.title: ZANU PF’s Ingenuity Saw Zimbabwe Survive the Evil Sanctions- Dr Mavaza
news.content:
By Dr Masimba Mavaza | Zimbabwe has been reeling under extreme, evil sanctions imposed by the West at the request of the opposition. It took great leadership from ZANU PF to navigate through the storms brought on by these illegal sanctions. Zimbabwes survival under such conditions can be attributed to several factorschief among them, the wisdom and strategic foresight of ZANU PF.

Through the innovative strategies of the ruling party, the country managed to survive the cruel and punishing sanctions. The government encouraged thinking outside the box to overcome economic challenges. The late Foreign Affairs Minister, Frederick Shava, consistently emphasized the need for innovative approaches to survive in spite of the sanctions.

Import SubstitutionZimbabwe promoted import substitution systems, similar to those adopted during the Rhodesian era, to reduce dependence on external goods. This approach has helped the country secure food self-sufficiency and relative economic stability.

Agricultural DevelopmentFaced with the devastating impact of sanctions, the government prioritized agricultural development, resulting in record production levels of crops like wheat and tobacco. This significantly contributed to national food security.

International EngagementZANU PFs leadership concentrated on strengthening global engagement. Zimbabwe pushed for the removal of sanctions and bolstered multilateral relations. President Mnangagwa, for example, highlighted the successes of the land reform program at the United Nations General Assembly.

Economic ResilienceDespite sanctions, Zimbabwe has shown remarkable economic resilience. Key sectors such as agriculture and manufacturing have continued contributing to the countrys growth, illustrating the nations ability to withstand adversity.

Challenges AheadTargeted sanctions remain the greatest challenge Zimbabwe faces. These measuresimposed by Western countries, including the US and UKare framed around alleged human rights and property rights issues. But in reality, they aim to force Zimbabwe to reverse its land reform program and bow to foreign pressure.

Steady Economic GrowthDespite these demonic sanctions, Zimbabwe has recorded steady economic growth. However, to sustain this growth, the country must continue addressing underlying issues such as corruption and governance inefficiencies.

Global CooperationZimbabwes continued engagement with the global community will be crucial for economic recovery and development. The country must remain innovative and resilient in the face of illegal sanctions imposed by Western powers.

Even under such pressure, we must survive as a nation. We must continue to think creatively and ask ourselves: if these sanctions last for years to come, how do we ensure Zimbabwe thrives?

Sanctions or no sanctions, Zimbabwe will survive. As long as ZANU PF remains in power, we will overcome.

Zimbabwes ability to adapt and withstand the economic and political pressures of sanctions speaks to its: Endurance  The capacity to persevere through hardship using innovative and resourceful methods. Self-sufficiency  Reducing dependency on external forces by harnessing domestic capabilities. Triumph  Achieving success against sanctions through diplomacy, resilience, and intelligent leadership. Liberation  Breaking free from externally imposed constraints to reclaim political and economic independence. Empowerment  Gaining strength, confidence, and self-determination through overcoming adversity.

In Zimbabwes context, surviving sanctions is a powerful testament to our resilience and determination. Our victory against these measures marks a significant milestonedemonstrating that, despite immense external pressure, Zimbabwe can adapt, survive, and thrive.

We shall always remember:ZANU PF VANHU. VANHU I ZANU PF.
